abstract.text: Make it easy for users to log into apps and services.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use the Authentication Services framework to improve the experience of users when they enter credentials to establish their identity.
Give users the ability to sign into your services with their Apple ID.
Enable users to look up their stored passwords from within the sign-in flow of an app.
Provide a passwordless registration and authentication workflow for apps and websites using iCloud Keychain or a physical security key.
Perform automatic security upgrades from weak to strong passwords, or upgrade to using Sign in with Apple.
Share data between an app and a web browser using technologies like OAuth to leverage existing web-based logins in the app.
Create a single sign-on (SSO) experience in an enterprise app.
Simple and straightforward sign-up and sign-in flows reduce the burden on the user to remember passwords, which may improve security.

abstract.text: Make it easy for users to log into apps and services.
An object that performs a request to modify an account’s authentication properties.
An object that you interact with to change an account’s password or to upgrade to Sign in with Apple.
A view controller that can upgrade user passwords to strong passwords, or convert accounts to use Sign in with Apple.
A credential that results from a successful Apple ID authentication.
A mechanism for generating requests to authenticate users based on their Apple ID.
A controller that manages authorization requests that a provider creates.
An array of custom authorization methods for the user to choose.
Informs the delegate when authorization completes, and specifies the custom method the user selected.
The custom authorization method.
A mechanism for generating requests to perform keychain credential sharing.
A encryption algorithm that uses NIST P-256 elliptic curve key agreement, ConcatKDF key derivation
with a 256-bit digest, and the Advanced Encryption Standard cipher in Galois/Counter Mode with a key length of 256 bits.
A cipher suite for HPKE that uses X25519 elliptic curve key agreement, SHA-2 key derivation
with a 256-bit digest, and the ChaCha20 stream cipher with the Poly1305 message authentication code.
A cipher suite for HPKE that uses NIST P-256 elliptic curve key agreement, SHA-2 key derivation
with a 256-bit digest, and the Advanced Encryption Standard cipher in Galois/Counter Mode with a key length of 256 bits.
A cipher suite that you use for HPKE using NIST P-384 elliptic curve key agreement, SHA-2 key derivation
with a 384-bit digest, and the Advanced Encryption Standard cipher in Galois/Counter Mode with a key length of 256 bits.
This type represents the inputs for the WebAuthentication PRF extension, when used during assertion requests.
The PRF extension lets you create general purpose SymmetricKeys from passkeys, which could useful for tasks such as encryption of user data.
The same input values used with the same passkey will always produce the same SymmetricKey.
The outputs of the WebAuthentication PRF extension, when requested during an assertion. This object represents one or two SymmetricKeys which are available anywhere the passkey can be used.
These are general purpose keys which can be used for application-specific needs, such as encryption of user data.
These keys should not be stored or exported. They should only ever be derived as the result of an assertion operation, and then discarded when finished.
Describes the outcome of a successful authorization request.
A protocol for creating passkey requests.
The activity type used in user activity objects sent to importing apps.
A class to manage exporting credentials.
A class to manage importing credentials.
The key for the token in the user info dictionary of the user activity sent to importing apps.
A view controller that a password manager app uses to extend AutoFill.
A field that someone can edit within a credential.
This class encapsulates input for various WebAuthn extensions during passkey assertion.
This class encapsulates output for various WebAuthn extensions used during passkey assertion.
This class encapsulates input for various WebAuthn extensions during passkey registration.
This class encapsulates output for various WebAuthn extensions used during passkey registration.
A password credential.
This object represents the client data for a public key credential request, as defined in the WebAuthentication standard.
A session that an app uses to authenticate a user through a web service.
A session manager that mediates sharing data between an app and a web browser.
A SwiftUI environment value that views use to perform authorization requests.
The view that creates the Sign in with Apple button for display.
A SwiftUI environment value that views use to authenticate someone using a web service.
Use a web authentication session to authenticate a user in your app.

abstract.text: Allow users to sign in to a service without typing a password.

abstract.text: Provide a way for users of your app to set up an account and start using your services.

doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/d.title: Implementing User Authentication with Sign in with Apple

abstract.text: Register and authenticate website users by using passkeys.
Use credentials from macOS login to perform single sign-on with an identity provider.
Help people efficiently perform multifactor authentication.
Register and authenticate users with passkeys and security keys, without using passwords.
Use time-based codes generated on-device for a secure authentication experience.

doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/d.title: Securing Logins with iCloud Keychain Verification Codes

abstract.text: Build a fluid sign-in experience for your tvOS apps using AuthenticationServices.

doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/d.title: Simplifying User Authentication in a tvOS App

abstract.text: Extend your web browser app to handle web authentication requests from other apps.

doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/d.title: Supporting Single Sign-On in a Web Browser App

abstract.text: Automatically and transparently convert accounts to Sign in with Apple or to use strong passwords for improved security.

doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/d.title: Upgrading Account Security With an Account Authentication Modification Extension

abstract.text: An entitlement that lets your app use Sign in with Apple.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the app may, with user permission, provide user names and passwords for AutoFill in Safari and other apps.
A collection of keys that a browser app uses to declare its ability to handle authentication requests from other apps.
Streamline your app’s login and onboarding procedures.
